title: 6 takeaways from Marco Sturm’s first practice as Bruins head coach
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "We have to come together as a team.
I don't care who's out there or not, that's how we're going to start.
” Marco Sturm held his first practice as Bruins head coach on Thursday.

title: Yankees fan builds miniature Fenway Park for his Red Sox–loving father
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Local News When his father's health issues stopped him from going to the game, this Yankees fan stepped in and brought Fenway Park to him.
Antonio Bisono sits in the miniature Fenway Park his son built for him.
Michael Bisono ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Rhode Island man charged in alleged assault after youth basketball game
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Christopher Cherry allegedly swung a knife at a referee following a basketball game in Providence on Saturday.

Barry Chin/Boston Globe Staff By Abby Patkin September 18, 2025 | 3:38 PM 2 minutes to read A Rhode Island man is facing assault charges after he allegedly swung a knife at a referee following a youth basketball game in Providence on Saturday.
Christopher Cherry, 37, turned himself in to police Wednesday after a warrant was issued for his arrest, Providence officials said in a statement.

bullets: Entertainment The 2025 fall movie preview has films for every taste, including Oscar hopefuls like "One Battle After Another," family-friendly films like "Zootopia 2," and blockbusters like "Avatar: Fire & Ash.

title: Lawyer found guilty of smuggling drugs into prison gets conviction overturned
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Judge orders a new trial after years of appeals, over questions of substitute expert witnesses.
An exterior photograph of the John Adams Courthouse, where the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court is located.

title: Massport eyes ‘remote terminal,’ allowing passengers to skip security lines in Logan Airport
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Passengers would be able to go through TSA screening in Framingham before boarding a secure bus to Logan.
Massport is planning a pilot program where passengers can go through TSA screening in Framingham before boarding a bus to Logan, avoiding lines in the airport.
Illustration courtesy of the Massachusetts Port Authority Travelers flying out of Boston may soon have a new way of avoiding the headaches of security lines inside Logan Airport.

title: Woman who allegedly shoved older rider off bus has been arrested
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Transit Police previously said the woman had an infant with her when she “violently shoved” an older passenger off a bus in Roxbury.
The suspect.

MBTA Transit Police By Abby Patkin September 18, 2025 | 12:39 PM 1 minute to read Authorities have identified and arrested a woman who allegedly shoved an older passenger off an MBTA bus in Boston last week.

title: ‘It fulfilled a lifelong dream’: Charlie Coyle thanks Bruins fans with social media message
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston Bruins Coyle played in Boston for parts of seven seasons before being dealt earlier in 2025.
Charlie Coyle at Bruins training camp in 2024.

John Tlumacki/Globe Staff By Hayden Bird September 18, 2025 | 12:33 PM 1 minute to read Weymouth native Charlie Coyle is no longer on the Bruins, but he wants local fans to know how much his tenure in Boston meant to him.

title: A New England location is one of the best destinations for fall colors in the U.S. this year, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel Also, one of the nation's best fall festivals is in Massachusetts.

White Mountains fall foliage 2020 drone video Michael Holzwarth By Kristi Palma September 18, 2025 | 12:28 PM 1 minute to read New England has epic fall foliage, but the colors in New Hampshire’s White Mountains take it to a whole other level, according to USA Today readers.
The publication released a list of the 10 best places to see fall colors in the U.
